moduleRef.include: bibl date desc email gap graphic head label measure media meeting name note num p pb pubPlace publisher ref resp respStmt teiCorpus term time title unit

appInfo application availability catDesc catRef category change classDecl correction edition editionStmt editorialDecl encodingDesc extent fileDesc funder hyphenation idno langUsage language licence listPrefixDef namespace normalization prefixDef profileDesc projectDesc publicationStmt quotation revisionDesc segmentation sourceDesc tagUsage tagsDecl taxonomy teiHeader textClass titleStmt
equipment incident kinesic recording recordingStmt u vocal
addName affiliation birth death education event forename listEvent listOrg listPerson listRelation nameLink occupation org orgName persName person placeName relation roleName sex surname

elementSpec.desc: contains one whole corpus, stored in the corpus root file comprising the corpus header and XInclude references to corpus component files, each containing a TEI element.

exemplum.eg: <teiCorpus xml:lang="en" xml:id="ParlaMint-GB"> <teiHeader> <!-- header for corpus --> </teiHeader> <!-- First (oldest) corpus component --> <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="2015/ParlaMint-GB_2015-01-05-commons.xml"/> <!-- Second corpus component --> <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="2015/ParlaMint-GB_2015-01-06-commons.xml"/> <!-- etc. --> </teiCorpus>

elementSpec.desc: used to include a corpus component (a TEI element) into the corpus root (the teiCorpus element).

exemplum.eg: <teiCorpus xml:lang="en" xml:id="ParlaMint-GB"> <teiHeader> <!-- header for corpus --> </teiHeader> <!-- First (oldest) corpus component --> <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="2015/ParlaMint-GB_2015-01-05-commons.xml"/> <!-- Second corpus component --> <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="2015/ParlaMint-GB_2015-01-06-commons.xml"/> <!-- etc. --> </teiCorpus>

elementSpec.desc: contains a single TEI-conformant document, combining a single TEI header with one or more members of the model.resource class. Multiple TEI elements may be combined within a TEI (or teiCorpus) element.

exemplum.p: Example of basic TEI element structure:

publicationStmt.p: First published as part of TEI P2, this is the P5 version using a name space.

sourceDesc.p: No source: this is an original work.

body.p: This is about the shortest TEI document imaginable.

titleStmt.title: Great Britain parliamentary corpus ParlaMint-GB, Lords, 2017-01-24
Minutes of the House of Lords, Daily Session 2017-01-24

bibl.title: UK Parliamentary Corpus. Volume 778. Tuesday 24th January 2017.

elementSpec.desc: contains a single text of any kind, whether unitary or composite, for example a poem or drama, a collection of essays, a novel, a dictionary, or a corpus sample.
contains the whole body of a single unitary text, excluding any front or back matter.

egXML.body:
Child Poverty Unit Question Asked by ... ...
...
Trade Union Act 2016 (Political Funds) Motion to Approve Moved by ... ...
...

elementSpec.desc: contains a subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.

valItem.desc: General purpose text division for all parts of parliamentary proceedings. If needed, the @subtype attribute can be used for additional content classification.

elementSpec.desc: contains a note or annotation.

valItem.desc: Description in the third person of events taking place in the meeting, e.g. "Mr X. takes the Chair".
Summaries of speeches that are individually not interesting, e.g. "Question put and agreed to".
Name, role and possible description of a person doing the speech
The location of the speaker, who was not on the podium
Date and time of the beginning and end of the debate
The presence of the members of parliament
Comments on the conduct of debates

exemplum.p: note element can be used to encode transcriber comments such as who spoke, what the time was, interruptions, notes on what is happening in the chamber, results of voting...:
exemplum.egXML: The president, Dr. Milan Brglez: ... The session began at 10 o'clock. ... 84 voted for the adoption of the measure. ... 2 voted against the adoption of the measure. ...

exemplum.p: The note element may also be used to mark additional information on debate sections:

elementSpec.desc: marks any vocalized but not necessarily lexical phenomenon, for example voiced pauses, non-lexical backchannels, etc.
marks any communicative phenomenon, not necessarily vocalized, for example a gesture, frown, etc.

kinesic.desc: sign for the end of discussion

elementSpec.desc: marks any phenomenon or occurrence, not necessarily vocalized or communicative, for example incidental noises or other events affecting communication.

incident.desc: He stands and with him the whole Assembly
The Assembly observed a minute of silence. Applause.
Arrival of the President of the Republic of Poland

elementSpec.desc: indicates a point where material has been omitted in a transcription, whether for editorial reasons described in the TEI header, as part of sampling practice, or because the material is illegible, invisible, or inaudible.
contains a short description of the purpose, function, or use of its parent element, or when the parent is a documentation element, describes or defines the object being documented.

exemplum.egXML:
Example of a desc element for transcriber comments:
sounds from the chamber
...
signal for end of debate
...
minute of silence

exemplum.p: Example of a desc element used as a part of taxonomy:

exemplum.egXML:
Example of a desc to describe gaps in the transcript: ... I would further state that
speaker spoke too quietly, not understood
and furthermore ...

elementSpec.desc: contains a single-word, multi-word, or symbolic designation which is regarded as a technical term.

egXML.catDesc: acl: Clausal modifier of noun (adjectival clause)

elementSpec.desc: defines a reference to another location, possibly modified by additional text or comment.

projectDesc.p: ParlaMint is a project that aims to (1) create a multilingual set of comparable corpora of parliamentary proceedings uniformly encoded according to the Parla-CLARIN recommendations and covering the COVID-19 pandemic from November 2019 as well as the earlier period from 2015 to serve as a reference corpus; (2) process the corpora linguistically to add Universal Dependencies syntactic structures and Named Entity annotation; (3) make the corpora available through concordancers and Parlameter; and (4) build use cases in Political Sciences and Digital Humanities based on the corpus data.

elementSpec.desc: marks the beginning of a new page in a paginated document.
contains a stretch of speech usually preceded and followed by silence or by a change of speaker.

exemplum.p: The element u marks up a speech, as illustrated below:

u.seg: I ask that the draft Regulations laid before the House on 5 December be approved.
The relevant document is the 20th Report from the Legislation Committee.

elementSpec.desc: represents any segmentation of text below the chunk level.

u.seg: I ask that the draft Regulations laid before the House on 5 December be approved.
The relevant document is the 20th Report from the Legislation Committee.

elementSpec.desc: contains a sentence-like division of a text.
represents a grammatical (not necessarily orthographic) word.

exemplum.p: Certain frameworks, in particular the Universal Dependencies, allow for tokens to be decomposed into several words, and it is these syntactic words, and not tokens, that are further annotated. For example, Czech has the word ‘abyste’ which is in UD decomposed into two syntactic words, ‘aby’ and ‘byste’, which can be encoded in the w element:

elementSpec.desc: contains a character or string of characters regarded as constituting a single punctuation mark.
defines a collection of associations or hypertextual links.

exemplum.p: Syntactic analysis is stored in the link group, linkGrp element, which is then composed of link elements. The example below illustrating this is given, for readability, without the word-level linguistic attributes and with shortened IDs:

elementSpec.desc: defines an association or hypertextual link among elements or passages, of some type not more precisely specifiable by other elements.

exemplum.p: Element link, given in linkGrp joins two tokens according to their syntactic dependency. The example below illustrating this is given, for readability, without the word-level linguistic attributes and with shortened IDs:

elementSpec.desc: contains a proper noun or noun phrase.

exemplum.p: Element name can be used to specify location of the meeting:
The element may also be used to denote person's responsibility for possible changes:
name element can also be used to mark up Named Entities:

elementSpec.desc: contains a number, written in any form.
contains a date in any format.

exemplum.p: The element date gives the date of the release in the ISO 8601 format, while the textual content can give it according to the conventions used in the local language:

elementSpec.desc: contains a phrase defining a time of day in any format.
contains an email address identifying a location to which email messages can be delivered.
supplies descriptive and declarative metadata associated with a digital resource or set of resources.

exemplum.p: Basic structure of the teiHeader:

availability.p: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.

elementSpec.desc: contains a full bibliographic description of an electronic file.

exemplum.p: Basic structure of the fileDesc element:
Example of the fileDesc element in the corpus:

bibl.title: Minutes of the Eerste Kamer of The Netherlands

elementSpec.desc: groups information about the title of a work and those responsible for its content.

exemplum.p: The titleStmt element gives the title of the corpus root or component, along with the specification of the particular session(s) of the parliament contained, the persons responsible for compiling the corpus and the funder(s) of the project:

titleStmt.title: Slovenski parlamentarni korpus ParlaMint-SI [ParlaMint]
Slovenian parliamentary corpus ParlaMint-SI [ParlaMint]
Zapisi sej Državnega zbora Republike Slovenije, 7. in 8. mandat (2014 - 2020)
Minutes of the National Assembly of the Republic of Slovenia, Term 7 and 8 (2014 - 2020)

elementSpec.desc: contains a title for any kind of work.

remarks.p: Attribute is required in titleStmt context.

egXML.title: Parlament České republiky, Poslanecká sněmovna
Parliament of the Czech Republic, Chamber of Deputies

elementSpec.desc: contains the formalized descriptive title for a meeting or conference, for use in a bibliographic description for an item derived from such a meeting, or as a heading or preamble to publications emanating from it.

exemplum.p: specification of the particular sessions that the corpus contains are encoded as meeting

egXML.titleStmt: Slovenski parlamentarni korpus ParlaMint-SI [ParlaMint] Slovenian parliamentary corpus ParlaMint-SI [ParlaMint] Zapisi sej Državnega zbora Republike Slovenije, 7. in 8. mandat (2014 - 2020) Minutes of the National Assembly of the Republic of Slovenia, Term 7 and 8 (2014 - 2020) 7. mandat 8. mandat ...

elementSpec.desc: supplies a statement of responsibility for the intellectual content of a text, edition, recording, or series, where the specialized elements for authors, editors, etc. do not suffice or do not apply. May also be used to encode information about individuals or organizations which have played a role in the production or distribution of a bibliographic work.

respStmt.resp: Data retrieval, Parla-CLARIN TEI XML corpus encoding and linguistic annotation.

exemplum.egXML:
Tommaso Agnoloni Francesca Frontini Simonetta Montemagni Valeria Quochi Giulia Venturi Definizione del progetto e metodologia Project set-up and methodology
Manuela Ruisi Carlo Marchetti Roberto Battistoni Recupero dei dati Data retrieval
Tommaso Agnoloni Codifica corpus in ParlaMint TEI XML ParlaMint TEI XML corpus encoding Pulizia, normalizzazione e conversione in ParlaMint TEI XML Cleaning, normalisation and conversion to ParlaMint TEI XML
...

elementSpec.desc: contains a proper noun or proper-noun phrase referring to a person, possibly including one or more of the person's forenames, surnames, honorifics, added names, etc.

remarks.p: Special persons (like 'anonymous', 'group' etc.) have their name in term.

elementSpec.desc: contains a forename, given or baptismal name.
contains an additional name component, such as a nickname, epithet, or alias, or any other descriptive phrase used within a personal name.
contains a connecting phrase or link used within a name but not regarded as part of it, such as van der or of.
contains a name component which indicates that the referent has a particular role or position in society, such as an official title or rank.
contains a family (inherited) name, as opposed to a given, baptismal, or nick name.
contains a phrase describing the nature of a person's intellectual responsibility, or an organization's role in the production or distribution of a work.
specifies the name of an individual, institution, or organization responsible for the funding of a project or text.
contains an organizational name.

remarks.p: Used when "the same" party changes its name
Used when "the same" party changes its name

elementSpec.desc: groups information relating to one edition of a text.
describes the particularities of one edition of a text.
describes the approximate size of a text stored on some carrier medium or of some other object, digital or non-digital, specified in any convenient units.
contains a word or phrase referring to some quantity of an object or commodity, usually comprising a number, a unit, and a commodity name.
groups information concerning the publication or distribution of an electronic or other text.

availability.p: To delo je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva 4.0 mednarodna licenca.
This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.

elementSpec.desc: provides the name of the organization responsible for the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item.
supplies any form of identifier used to identify some object, such as a bibliographic item, a person, a title, an organization, etc. in a standardized way.

remarks.p: sample values recomended to use with type="URI"

sourceDesc.bibl: Zapisi sej Državnega zbora Republike Slovenije ... https://www.dz-rs.si ...

elementSpec.desc: supplies information about the availability of a text, for example any restrictions on its use or distribution, its copyright status, any licence applying to it, etc.

availability.p: Ovaj rad je dostupan pod međunarodnom licencom Creative Commons Imenovanje 4.0
This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License

elementSpec.desc: contains information about a licence or other legal agreement applicable to the text.

exemplum.p: The licence specifies fixed-value CC BY 4.0 URL, and in the following paragraph gives a prose description of the licence:

egXML.p: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License

exemplum.p: The textual information on licence can be given in more than one language:

egXML.p: Ovaj rad je dostupan pod međunarodnom licencom Creative Commons Imenovanje 4.0
This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License

elementSpec.desc: marks paragraphs in prose.

availability.p: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.
This work is also licensed under the Open Parliament Licence v3.0.

elementSpec.desc: describes the source(s) from which an electronic text was derived or generated, typically a bibliographic description in the case of a digitized text, or a phrase such as "born digital" for a text which has no previous existence.

exemplum.p: The source description sourceDesc of the corpus root encodes the original digital source of the ParlaMint corpus:

bibl.title: Zapisi sej Državnega zbora Republike Slovenije
Minutes of the National Assembly of the Republic of Slovenia

exemplum.p: For corpus components the source description is very similar to the one for the corpus root, except it reflects information of the exact meeting. Furthermore, if the audio or video of the meeting is available, this information can also be given:

bibl.title: Parlament České republiky, Poslanecká sněmovna
Parliament of the Czech Republic, Chamber of Deputies

elementSpec.desc: contains a loosely-structured bibliographic citation of which the sub-components may or may not be explicitly tagged.

bibl.title: Minutes of the National Assembly of the Republic of Bulgaria

elementSpec.desc: describes a set of recordings used as the basis for transcription of a spoken text.
provides details of an audio or video recording event used as the source of a spoken text, either directly or from a public broadcast.
indicates the location of any form of external media such as an audio or video clip etc.
documents the relationship between an electronic text and the source or sources from which it was derived.
describes in detail the aim or purpose for which an electronic file was encoded, together with any other relevant information concerning the process by which it was assembled or collected.

projectDesc.p: Glavni cilji projekta ParlaMint so (1) izdelati večjezično množico na enak način kodiranih korpusov zapiskov parlamentarnih sej, (2) jezikoslovno označiti te korpuse; (3) narediti korpuse dostopne za prevzem in prek konkordančnikov; in (4) pripraviti primere uporabe korpusov v politologiji in digitalni humanistiki.

The ParlaMint project aims to (1) create a multilingual set of uniformly encoded comparable corpora of parliamentary proceedings (2) process the corpora linguistically; (3) make the corpora available for download and through concordancers; and (4) build use cases in Political Sciences and Digital Humanities based on the corpus data.

elementSpec.desc: provides details of editorial principles and practices applied during the encoding of a text.

correction.p: No correction of source texts was performed.

normalization.p: Text has not been normalised, except for spacing.

hyphenation.p: Hyphenation has not been altered with respect to the source files.

quotation.p: Quotation marks have been left in the text and are not explicitly marked up.

segmentation.p: The texts are segmented into utterances (contributions) and segments (corresponding to paragraphs in the source transcription).

elementSpec.desc: states how and under what circumstances corrections have been made in the text.

correction.p: No correction of source texts was performed.

elementSpec.desc: indicates the extent of normalization or regularization of the original source carried out in converting it to electronic form.

egXML.editorialDecl:
...
Text has not been normalised, except for spacing.
...

elementSpec.desc: summarizes the way in which hyphenation in a source text has been treated in an encoded version of it.

egXML.editorialDecl:
...
No end-of-line hyphens were present in the source.
...

elementSpec.desc: specifies editorial practice adopted with respect to quotation marks in the original.

egXML.editorialDecl:
...
Quotation marks have been left in the text and are not explicitly marked up.

elementSpec.desc: describes the principles according to which the text has been segmented, for example into sentences, tone-units, graphemic strata, etc.

segmentation.p: The texts are segmented into utterances (speeches) and segments (corresponding to paragraphs in the source transcription).

elementSpec.desc: provides detailed information about the tagging applied to a document.
supplies the formal name of the namespace to which the elements documented by its children belong.

exemplum.p: To distinguish the TEI elements from the possible use of elements from other namespaces, a namespace element giving the TEI namespace is introduced first:

elementSpec.desc: documents the usage of a specific element within a specified document.

attDef.desc: specifies the name (generic identifier) of the element indicated by the tag, within the namespace indicated by the parent namespace element. All descendats of text element and text element counts has to be included.

elementSpec.desc: contains one or more taxonomies defining any classificatory codes used elsewhere in the text.
defines a typology either implicitly, by means of a bibliographic citation, or explicitly by a structured taxonomy.

taxonomy.category:
Unità geo-politica o amministrativa
Geo-political or administrative units
Legislatura sovranazionale
Supranational legislature
Legislatura nazionale
National legislature
...

org.orgName: Senate of the Republic of Italy

elementSpec.desc: contains an individual descriptive category, possibly nested within a superordinate category, within a user-defined taxonomy.

category.catDesc: Session: A parliamentary year, which always begins on the first Tuesday in October at 12.00 o’clock noon and ends on the same date at the same time the following year. However, parliamentary work at Christiansborg is organised in such a way that it primarily takes place from October to June.

elementSpec.desc: describes some category within a taxonomy or text typology, either in the form of a brief prose description or in terms of the situational parameters used by the TEI formal textDesc.
contains a list of definitions of prefixing schemes used in teidata.pointer values, showing how abbreviated URIs using each scheme may be expanded into full URIs.

exemplum.p: In this example, two private URI scheme prefixes are defined and patterns are provided for dereferencing them. Each prefix is also supplied with a human-readable explanation in a p element.

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the psn prefix are pointers to person elements in the personography.xml file. For example, psn:MDH dereferences to personography.xml#MDH.
Private URIs using the bibl prefix can be expanded to form URIs which retrieve the relevant bibliographical reference from www.example.com.
Private URIs with this prefix point to elements giving their name. In this document they are simply local references into the UD-SYN taxonomy categories in the corpus root TEI header.

elementSpec.desc: defines a prefixing scheme used in teidata.pointer values, showing how abbreviated URIs using the scheme may be expanded into full URIs.

remarks.p: Using TEI-defined XPointer schemes is not allowed.

prefixDef.p: Private URIs with this prefix point to feature-structure elements defining the Serbocroatian MULTEXT-East Version 6 MSDs.

elementSpec.desc: records information about an application which has edited the TEI file.

application.label: Stanford CoreNLP
application.desc: Tokenisation, POS tagging, NER and dependency parsed using Stanford CoreNLP https://stanfordnlp.github.io/CoreNLP/.

application.label: NER system for South Slavic languages

elementSpec.desc: provides information about an application which has acted upon the document.

application.label: Stanza
application.desc: Stanza: a jointly trained neural tagger, lemmatizer and dependency parser. Pretrained model based on the italian-isdt-ud-2.5 treebank

application.label: T2K
application.desc: T2K: contains a named entity recognition module for Italian.

application.label: CoNLL-U 2 TEI XML
application.desc: CoNLL-U 2 TEI XML: converter from CoNLL-U format to (ParlaClarin/ParlaMint) Tei XML Format

application.label: Stanford CoreNLP
application.desc: Tokenisation, POS tagging, NER and dependency parsed using Stanford CoreNLP https://stanfordnlp.github.io/CoreNLP/.

elementSpec.desc: contains any label or heading used to identify part of a text, typically but not exclusively in a list or glossary.

exemplum.p: Labels denote the existence of organizations and connected events:

egXML.org:
Državni zbor Republike Slovenije National Assembly of the Republic of Slovenia
existence
...
Mandatno obdobje
Legislative period
7. mandat Term 7
8. mandat Term 8

exemplum.p: Labels may also be used to give a name to the tools used in compiling the corpus:

application.label: INT Tagger, lemmatizer and Tokenizer
application.desc: INT Tagger, lemmatizer and Tokenizer for modern Dutch, based on old-school machine learning (SVM). It provides the legacy PoS tags (encoded in w/@ana) and the lemmata for Dutch. Not publicly available.

exemplum.p: Labels may also be used for other structured list items:

elementSpec.desc: provides a detailed description of non-bibliographic aspects of a text, specifically the languages and sublanguages used, the situation in which it was produced, the participants and their setting.

exemplum.p: Basic structure of the element profileDesc:

elementSpec.desc: describes the setting or settings within which a language interaction takes place, or other places otherwise referred to in a text, edition, or metadata.
describes one particular setting in which a language interaction takes place.
groups information which describes the nature or topic of a text in terms of a standard classification scheme, thesaurus, etc.
specifies one or more defined categories within some taxonomy or text typology.
describes the identifiable speakers, voices, or other participants in any kind of text or other persons named or otherwise referred to in a text, edition, or metadata.

org.orgName: Lietuvos valstiečių ir žaliųjų sąjungos frakcija
Faction of the Lithuanian Farmers and Greens Union

elementSpec.desc: contains a list of elements, each of which provides information about an identifiable organization.
contains any type of heading, for example the title of a section, or the heading of a list, glossary, manuscript description, etc.

exemplum.p: The most common use for the head element is to mark the headings of sections:

egXML.div: Regulation of Health and Social Care Professions Etc. Bill [HL] ...

exemplum.p: The label element may also be used to mark events in relation to the parliament organisations:

egXML.org:
Federaal Parlement van België Belgian Federal Parliament ...
Zittingsperiode
Legislative period
Zittingsperiode 51 Legislative period 51
...

elementSpec.desc: provides information about an identifiable organization such as a business, a tribe, or any other grouping of people.

org.orgName: The Board of Directors of the General Health Insurance Company of the Czech Republic

elementSpec.desc: contains data relating to any kind of significant event associated with a person, place, or organization.

event.label: Fifty-fifth Parliament of the United Kingdom

org.orgName: Government of the Republic of Croatia

elementSpec.desc: contains a list of descriptions, each of which provides information about an identifiable event.

event.label: 11. vlada Republike Slovenije (20. marec 2013 - 18. september 2014)
11th Government of the Republic of Slovenia (20 March 2013 - 18 September 2014)
14. vlada Republike Slovenije (13. marec 2020 - danes)
14th Government of the Republic of Slovenia (March 13, 2020 - today)

org.orgName: Senate of the Republic of Italy

elementSpec.desc: provides information about relationships identified amongst people, places, and organizations, either informally as prose or as formally expressed relation links.
describes any kind of relationship or linkage amongst a specified group of places, events, persons, objects or other items.

contains a list of descriptions, each of which provides information about an identifiable person or a group of people, for example the participants in a language interaction, or the people referred to in a historical source.
provides information about an identifiable individual, for example a participant in a language interaction, or a person referred to in a historical source.
specifies the sex of a person.
contains information about a person's birth, such as its date and place.
contains information about a person's death, such as its date and place.
contains an absolute or relative place name.
contains an informal description of a person's present or past affiliation with some organization, for example an employer or sponsor.

egXML.p: The affiliation element can also include an ana attribute, which points to the appropriate legislative period when the person was affiliated with the specified organisation.

remarks.p:
Affiliation to organization can be done in three ways (sorted from most concrete - the best solution):
ref
key
text value

elementSpec.desc: contains an informal description of a person's trade, profession or occupation.
contains a description of the educational experience of a person.

egXML.education: Bachelor of Science, Electrical and Information Technology Engineer

elementSpec.desc: groups elements representing or containing graphic information such as an illustration, formula, or figure.
indicates the location of a graphic or illustration, either forming part of a text, or providing an image of it.
describes the languages, sublanguages, registers, dialects, etc. represented within a text.
characterizes a single language or sublanguage used within a text.
summarizes the revision history for a file
documents a change or set of changes made during the production of a source document, or during the revision of an electronic file.

revisionDesc.change: Tommaso Agnoloni: Generated corpus in ParlaMint.
